translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs🔽The Chapter with Sumedhā
The Elder Nun Sumedhā’s Verses
Homage to that Blessed One, perfected one, fully awakened Buddha.
Now listen to the elder nuns’ verses—
“In the time of the Blessed One Koṇāgamana,
in a new monastery in a Saṅgha dwelling place;
Three friends, three women,
we gave a dwelling place.
For ten times, a hundred times,
a thousand times, a hundred thousand times;
We were reborn among the gods,
what to say about human rebirths.
We were powerful gods,
what to say about human beings?
We were queens with seven jewels,
we were women jewels.
Here we accumulated wholesome actions,
we were born into a very wealthy family;
Dhanañjānī, Khemā,
and I, we three.
Having made a well-built monastery,
adorned with all the parts;
To the Saṅgha headed by the Buddha,
we dedicated it, having gathered together.
Wherever we were reborn,
by the power of that action;
We attained the highest position among the gods,
and likewise among humans.
In this very same aeon,
the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,
the best of speakers, Kassapa by name,

original: uppajji vadataṁ varo.🔽Upaṭṭhāko mahesissa,🔽tadā āsi narissaro;
analyzed: uppajji vadatam varaḥ  upaṭṭhākaḥ mahesissa  tadā āsi narissaraḥ
translated: appeared in the world.🔽The lord of men, the king of Kāsi,🔽the great lord’s attendant,
was named Kikī,
in the supreme city of Bārāṇasī.
He had seven daughters,
princesses, well-cared for,
devoted to attending on the Buddha,
they lived the spiritual life.
Being their companion,
well-composed in virtue,
having given gifts with respect,
I lived the spiritual life in the house.
By that good deed well done,
by my intention and aspiration,
having abandoned the human body,

original: tāvatiṁsūpagā ahaṁ.🔽Tato cutā yāmamagaṁ,🔽tatohaṁ tusitaṁ gatā;
analyzed: aha  tatas cutā yāmam aga  tatas ham tusitam gatā
translated: I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.🔽From there, having passed away, I went to the Yāma heaven,
from there I went to the Tusita heaven,🔽and from there to the Nimmānarati heaven,
and from there to the city of Vāsava.
Wherever I was reborn,
by the power of my meritorious deeds,
there I became the great lord
of the kings.
Having passed away from there, in the human state,🔽of the kings who rule the world,
and of the kings who rule a region,
I became the great lord.
Having experienced success
among the gods and among humans,
everywhere being happy,
I wandered through many births.
That was the cause, that was the reason,
that was the root of the dispensation:
First I understood that,
then I attained Nibbāna, the state of peace.
My defilements are burned away,
all my existences are uprooted;
Like a nāga that has cut its tethers,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha, the best of beings;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations as well,
The six super-knowledges have been realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ sumedhā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam sumedhā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus spoke the nun Sumedhā, and the monks were delighted and rejoiced in the nun Sumedhā’s words.
The first chapter on Sumedhā is finished.
